info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 5:02AM EDT until April 10 at 9:50AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River near Centerton down to Hazleton.
Eel River at Bowling Green.
.Widespread ongoing minor flooding along Eel River and the White River from Morgan County down to Knox County...will rise into Moderate Flood levels this morning at most points. Major flood levels are expected to follow in Knox County starting Sunday night. Flooding will crest on points in Clay and Morgan County tonight... and downstream points next week. Major Flooding may last for several days along Knox County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River near Centerton.
* WHEN...Until late Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.8 feet, Flood waters cover the flood plain along SR 39 connecting SRs 37 and 67 just southwest of Martinsville. Flooding causes the evacuation of a few homes and damages Blue Bluff Road near IPL Power Plant. Local river roads are impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EDT Saturday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 815 PM EDT /715 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Monroe, IN; Morgan, IN; Owen, IN
